script.message: Let us start by adding some neurons to our workspace.
Now let us click on it.
We can now see the associated lines on the left panel.
Hover over the '?' symbol to see a visualization of the line.
You can also click on the names in yellow to see an information page about them.

1.description: Retrieve a match for a single neuron.

script.message: Let us start by adding some neurons to our workspace.
Now let us press the line match button, and the matches will be visible in the information panel.
This search can take a while! You can use it on any group of neurons, but the query might take a long time for neuron groups larger than 50.

2.description: Retrieve a match for a group of neurons.

3.keyword: Retrieve a line from a paper.

script.message: Reading the paper with DOI 10.1016/j.neuron.2018.08.037, we find that the split-GAL4 line LH989 targets the PD2a1/PD2b1 neurons.
We can query for 'load line LH989' to bring up all images for this line.
We can also use a specific image, for example with 'load line LH989 2711777429851996171'
You can now get the matches for some of these neurons by clicking on the green + button!
